jd: From: Ben, Heliogic LLC ben@heliogic.com Reply to: ben@heliogic.com Role: Technical Project Manager (Only Local)Location: Santa Clara, CA 95054 (Onsite) Key Responsibilities:Project Management – Project planning and management including scope, schedule, velocity, efficiency, quality; Create and manage detailed project plans for each milestone and releasesResource Coordination – Resource allocation, ensuring availability and capacity management; Team members growth and trainings identificationRisk and Change Management – Manage changes to project scope, schedule, and costs using appropriate verification techniques; Perform risk management to minimize project risksPerformance Measurement – Measure project performance using appropriate systems, tools, and techniques; Report and escalate to management as neededDocumentation and Quality Assurance – Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation; Oversee quality assurance and ensure objectives are metBudget & Financial Management – Planning and managing project budgets to ensure financial resources are used effectively; Budgeting, forecasting, and managing financial resourcesTechnical Proficiency – Provide technical guidance and support to the project team; Ensure technical feasibility of projects.Post-Project Evaluation – Conduct post-project evaluation and identify successful and unsuccessful project elements; Applying learnings for future projects and sharing with delivery team for wider learning Skills:Strong understanding of project management methodologies is requiredExperience of executing projects in Agile methodology using scrum frameworkCapable of providing gap analysis and needs assessments to uncover business needsProactively identifying future blockers and gaps and working closely with the team and client to minimize productivity lossGenerating data centric metrics, effective reports, and dashboards Able to lead the technical team by providing guidanceIdentifying the need of aligning the technical architect, product owner, QE lead or right stakeholder with the team as per the requirement Working with multiple internal and stakeholders and vendors and resolving dependencies and blockersStrong experience in leading, facilitating and motivating teams for small to medium IT projects requiredBachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or related fieldPMP, SAFe, CSM, or similar project management certification is a plusExcellent client-facing and internal communication skills.
